definition: to lean against or on/to stand by the side of/to come near to/to depend on/to trust/to fuck (vulgar)/traditional military costume drama where the performers wear armor (old)

sentences.english: She leaned on my chest. I could smell the fragrance of her blouse.
sentences.chinese: 妻斜靠在我胸部上，我還聞得到她外套上芳香的味道。

sentences.english: The heaving of the ship made her dizzy and she leanedagainst the handrail.
sentences.chinese: 輪船的起伏讓她頭暈眼花，她斜靠在扶手上。

sentences.english: The lean man leans on the wash bean plant to read a foliage pamphlet.
sentences.chinese: 瘦人斜靠在乾淨的豆科植物上讀葉片傳單。

sentences.english: The lean man leans on the clean bean plant to read a leafleaflet.
sentences.chinese: 瘦人斜靠在乾淨的豆類植物上讀葉片傳單。

sentences.english: I had to sleep propped up on pillows so I could breathe.
sentences.chinese: 睡覺時必須得斜靠在枕頭上才能呼吸順暢。

sentences.english: After all the guests had gone, the drunk master leaned against the tree and fell asleep.
sentences.chinese: 當賓客散去後，喝醉了的男主人斜靠在槐樹下睡着了。

sentences.english: He remains there, unnoticed, slumped against the side of the car.
sentences.chinese: 他一直斜靠在車身上，沒有人注意到他。

sentences.english: The teacher leaned against the blackboard.
She leaned her bike against the stone wall and stood on tiptoe to peer over it.
sentences.chinese: 她把自行車斜靠在石牆上，踮起腳往牆內張望。

sentences.english: The painter pitched the ladder against the wall.
sentences.chinese: 油漆匠將梯子斜靠在牆上。

sentences.english: His rifle with the bayonet fixed was leaning against the wall.
sentences.chinese: 他的上了刺刀的步槍斜靠在牆上。

sentences.english: The lean man leans on the neat bean plant to peruse a foliage pamphlet.
sentences.chinese: 瘦人斜靠在乾淨的豆科植物上讀葉片傳單。

sentences.english: He stood there leaning against the wall.
The lean man leans on the clean leafy bean plant .
sentences.chinese: 那個瘦人斜靠在乾淨多葉的豆科植物上。

sentences.english: Andy sighs, cocks his head at the projector.
sentences.chinese: 安迪嘆口氣，頭斜靠在放映機上。

sentences.english: He leaned against the four-door Chevy sedan.
sentences.chinese: 他斜靠在四門的雪弗萊。

definition: to doze/to take a nap/nodding off to sleep
one leg over the other (legs crossed)
to relax with one's eyes closed
to be calm and unruffled in the midst of chaos or at a busy time (idiom)
